column1: Wildberry Pancakes and Cafe////I really wish that yelp allowed us to give 1/2 stars
column2: because I would give Wildberry 3 1/2 stars
column3: but I'll stick with 3 for this review. The wait wasn't too bad - only a 35 minute wait for a party of 4 on a Sunday. Go anywhere else in the loop area at this day/time
column4: and you are looking at an hour. The pancakes were great - I got the buttermilk pancakes with bananas. Also tasted the pumpkin spice pancakes
column5: which were tasty. Not too sweet
column6: but nice well-rounded use of spices. The bacon was good
column7: but the eggs needed a little more seasoning. One of my friends tried the french toast and said that it wasn't very good. Stay away from the french toast and get the pancakes instead. Nevertheless
column8: this is a good solid brunch place - I'd go back.
